sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

All 8 vocabulary words:

letter → ?      page → ?
sentence → ?    comment → ?
cite → ?        utter → ?
journal → ?     data → ?

(Answers: lerfu, papri, jufra, pinka, sitna, bacru, karni, datni)

Grammar Summary (3-4 min)

be/bei/be'o Functions

Cmavo Function Example
be Attaches x2 lo vecnu be lo cukta
bei Attaches x3, x4... lo dunda be X bei Y
be'o Terminates lo vecnu be X be'o poi Y

When to Use Each

Situation Use
Simple x2 be X
Multiple places be X bei Y bei Z
Before poi/noi be X be'o poi...
Before cu Optional (be'o elidable)

Week 23 Vocabulary

Lojban English Lojban English
lerfu letter papri page
jufra sentence pinka comment
sitna cite bacru utter
karni journal datni data

Self-Test (5-6 min)

Part A: Vocabulary (8 points)

Translate:

  1. lerfu →
  2. jufra →
  3. sitna →
  4. karni →

Translate to Lojban:

  1. page →
  2. comment →
  3. utter →
  4. data →
Answers
  1. letter/character
  2. sentence
  3. cite/quote
  4. journal
  5. papri
  6. pinka
  7. bacru
  8. datni

Part B: be/bei/be'o (8 points)

Translate:

  1. The seller of books.
  2. The giver of apples to me.
  3. The speaker of Lojban.
  4. The teacher of math to children.

Choose: Is be'o needed?

  1. lo vecnu be lo cukta poi barda — Is poi modifying cukta or vecnu?
  2. lo vecnu be lo cukta be'o poi barda — Is poi modifying cukta or vecnu?
  3. lo vecnu be lo cukta cu klama — Is be'o needed?
  4. lo dunda be lo plise bei mi — Any terminator needed?
Answers
  1. lo vecnu be lo cukta
  2. lo dunda be lo plise bei mi
  3. lo tavla be la .jbobau.
  4. lo ctuca be la .cmaci. bei lo verba
  5. cukta (without be'o, poi attaches to nearest)
  6. vecnu (be'o closes be-structure)
  7. No (cu serves as separator)
  8. No (at end of description)

Part C: Complex Descriptions (4 points)

Translate:

  1. The writer of poems, who is beautiful.
  2. The reader of journals about data.
  3. One who wants to learn (wanter of learning).
  4. The seller of books to Alice, who is old.
Answers
  1. lo ciska be lo pemci be'o poi melbi
  2. lo tcidu be lo karni be lo datni
  3. lo djica be lo nu cilre
  4. lo vecnu be lo cukta bei la .alis. be'o poi slabu

Integration Challenge (1-2 min)

Describe people by their roles:

Use at least:

  • Two be structures
  • One bei structure
  • One be'o with poi
  • Two vocabulary words

Example:

mi viska lo ctuca be la .cmaci. bei lo verba
.i ri lo ciska be lo jufra be'o poi clani
.i lo karni be lo datni cu cnino
.i mi nelci lo tcidu be lo papri

(I see the teacher of math to children. She is a writer of sentences, who is tall. The journal of data is new. I like the reader of pages.)

Create your own and say it aloud.

Week 23 Complete Reference

Vocabulary (8):

Lojban English Lojban English
lerfu letter papri page
jufra sentence pinka comment
sitna cite bacru utter
karni journal datni data

Grammar:

Cmavo Function
be Attaches x2 inside description
bei Attaches x3, x4, x5
be'o Terminates be/bei structure

Cumulative vocabulary: ~188 words

Summary

You completed Week 23 on be/bei/be'o. You can now fill places inside descriptions to create precise, specific descriptions.

Next week preview: Week 24 introduces quotation (lu...li'u, zo, lo'u...le'u) and discursives (ku'i, ji'a, po'o).
